You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Allow a Buyer to Manage Stored Payments on the My Account Page

Provide a buyer with self-service options for creating and maintaining payment details used in checkout or to settle an invoice. When you enable the My Wallet section of the My Account page, a buyer can review, add, edit, or delete the account's stored payments.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

The My Wallet section of the My Account page provides the following options:

An entry in the My Account page menu (1). You can optionally disable the My Wallet section in the My Account page menu.
A picklist of payment methods to add (2). When a buyer selects a payment method, they're navigated to the Stored Payment Detail page, where they can enter details for a new stored payment.
NOTE
By default, B2B Commerce for Visualforce supports only purchase order (PO) payments. You can set up other payment types, including credit cards, bank accounts, and so on.
For a new PO stored payment, you can optionally require that a buyer enters a PO number before they can save the payment for the account.

Each stored payment in the My Wallet section shows the following non-configurable information:

An optional name for the stored payment name (3).
The payment type (4).
Details for the payment method, such as the purchase order number (5).
A checkbox that indicates whether the stored payment is enabled on the storefront (6).
Buttons for editing or deleting a stored payment (7).
TIP You can format how these details display by modifying the appropriate page labels.

To configure the user experience of the My Wallet section, update your storefront configuration settings.

Enable stored payments.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select My Wallet (3).
Find the Enabled configuration (4), and make sure that its value is TRUE (5).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	My Wallet
Configuration	Enabled
Page	all
Value	TRUE
Verify that the My Wallet section is available in the My Account page menu.
From the Module picklist, select My Account Navigation Bar (6).
Find the Show My Wallet configuration (7), and make sure that its value is TRUE (8).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	My Account Navigation Bar
Configuration	Show My Wallet
Page	all
Value	TRUE
TIP To enable stored payments on the Checkout page but hide the My Wallet section of the My Account page, set the following configuration values:
The Enabled configuration of the My Wallet module is TRUE.
The Show My Wallet configuration of the My Account Navigation Bar module is FALSE.
If your storefront supports the default PO payments, specify whether a buyer must enter a PO number when adding a PO stored payment.
From the Module picklist, select Payment PO (9).
Find the Require PO Number configuration (10), and make sure that its value is TRUE (11).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Payment PO
Configuration	Require PO Number
Page	all
Value	TRUE
Optionally, set up payment types other than the default PO. Complete the steps in Set Up Payment Types for Storefront Purchases.
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
NOTE In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13), you can specify which API you want to use for fetching and deleting stored payment data:
The ccrz.cc_hk_Payment extension point API class, which provides compatibility with all previous versions of the managed package. To use this class, change the value of the Use Payment Hook configuration of the My Wallet module is TRUE.
The ccrz.ccApiStoredPayment global API class, which provides a more standardized interface and extensibility architecture than the extension point class. This class is recommended for all new solutions. To use this class, leave the value of the Use Payment Hook configuration of the My Wallet module FALSE.

For all previous versions of the managed package, the My Wallet section always uses the ccrz.cc_hk_Payment extension point API class.

SEE ALSO

title: Allow a Buyer to Manage Stored Payments
